poem:
No Sanctuary  

A gavel drops, and silence spreads  
across the pews, where whispered prayers   
turn to echoes, lost among the pillars.   
The judge, swift as a blade, divides  
the wounded from the balm, yet beneath  
the cloistered shadows, truth persists,  
like candlelight, flickering but unstilled.  
In fragile faith, survivors keep their vigil.
